comment: One thing, if the image it is decoding does not have a hidden message it will freeze the app at a certain spot in the decoding process. Other than this, it is a great concept.

title: Great idea
comment: Worked only once on several test pictures and password combinations. Constantly said bad password and couldn't see the hidden text just random letters, spaces and ? marks. Uninstall until they fix it to make it more reliable.

title: Love it
comment: Works every time lots of fun

title: Good but no password
comment: Just swipe to the left instead of clicking the padlock. Passwords won't decrypt even when using the proper method. It has been over a year. Time for a fix plz

title: nice idea but not working -

title: Has Potential, but currently is broken
comment: I hope this app is improved. As for now it's broken. It won't accept correct password for photos. It worked when I first installed it though, which is baffling. Right now I'm too afraid to use it. I would not store important information if I have a random chance of not getting it back. I'll keep it installed in the hope for an update.

comment: Thank you for everything Google play Store Team. The very best application.

title: Bout time
comment: I have been sharing hidden files in public view for years. Mp3s as jpegs and soft ware as .gifs or png's.  I'm glad to see others in the covert tip. Good job.

title: FTW

title: Worked. Once.
comment: I managed to encrypt, email, and decrypt 1 image. Now, it looks like I can encrypt messages, but the app crashes immediately when I try to decrypt anything.

title: Its good but.
comment: It's too slow to be used often. The loading times take far too long.

title: Great app
comment: To decrypt, simply open the the image, and choose pixelknot in the "open as" box.

title: Fantastic!
comment: This is one of the best apps I have ever tried.  Great job!

title: Perfect App
comment: This is an excellent easy to use app by the guardian project. After encoding image simply share the image via email or another protocol. Then to decode simply open your email client for ex. and download then open attachment with pixel knot to decode. Simple, Powerful!

title: Best of its kind
comment: This app works perfectly if you know how to use it. However, it is very much in need of some ux - the interface is pretty frustrating and little guidance is given to the user. Five stars, though, because it is the best app of its kind by a large margin.

title: Perfect
comment: To those who can't seem to figure out how to decrypt files, try "open as..." then choose PixelKnot, which is registered as a mime type handler for images (doh!). Works for me, and no crashes. :-)

title: Eroding my confidence in all your other apps
comment: If all your apps were as badly written as this and NoteCipher … I'm sorry but how can I trust that you can get anything right when you can't even get this to function correctly?

title: slick app
comment: works somewhat well, occasionally crashes while generating the steg'd image. haven't verified the security that is implied, but this vendor's rep seems good.

title: Very Disappointing
comment: Decryption has not worked one time yet; I always get a bad password message when I know better. Update: the password test worked one time and then not again. Not reliable. Hoped to recommend this like I have all your other apps...

title: How to decode?
comment: Great idea.  Straightforward to encode a message in an image. Where is the option to decode the image? I couldn't find it.

title: One small doubt
comment: How am I supposed to decode the images

title: Great app for steganography
comment: This is the only app I use for any of my steganography needs.

title: Crashes on Samsung Note Two
comment: Right after setting the password it crashes when on the Samsung Note Two. Tried it a number of times and keeps happening.

title: Works well
comment: Easy to use, slick and worked as expected.

title: This is Going to be Huge
comment: I'm SO excited to have stumbled upon this before the entire world knows about it! No doubt it's going to be quite popular in short order given the world's recent desire of privacy. Never would've guessed my little steganography hobby would lead to such a brilliant app!!
